00006 #ifndef USART0_DEFS_H
00007 #define USART0_DEFS_H
00008 
00009 /* You should be using the functions defined in usart0.h.  These
00010    macros are not for general use except in dire performance
00011    circumstances.  */
00012 
00013 #include "config.h"
00014 
00015 
00016 #define USART0_READ_READY_P() ((AT91C_BASE_US0->US_CSR & AT91C_US_RXRDY) != 0)
00017 
00018 #define USART0_WRITE_READY_P() ((AT91C_BASE_US0->US_CSR & AT91C_US_TXRDY) != 0)
00019 
00020 #define USART0_WRITE_FINISHED_P() ((AT91C_BASE_US0->US_CSR & AT91C_US_TXEMPTY) != 0)
00021 
00022 #define USART0_READ() AT91C_BASE_US0->US_RHR
00023 
00024 #define USART0_WRITE(VAL) AT91C_BASE_US0->US_THR = (VAL)
00025 
00026 
00027 #define USART0_PUTC(ch)                 \
00028 do                                      \
00029 {                                       \
00030     while (!USART0_WRITE_READY_P ())    \
00031         continue;                       \
00032                                         \
00033     USART0_WRITE (ch);                  \
00034 } while (0)
00035 
00036 
00037 /* The US_BRGR register is 32-bit.  The 16-LSBs specify the baud rate
00038    divisor.  Bits 16--18 specify a fractional divisor.  We set these
00039    bits to zero to ignore the fractional part.  */
00040 #define USART0_BAUD_DIVISOR_SET(DIVISOR)  AT91C_BASE_US0->US_BRGR = (DIVISOR)

00042 
00043 #endif /* USART0_DEFS_H  */
